result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Burgess Tremaine-Malik Smith Jr

defendant.name: Smith, Burgess Tremaine-Malik, Jr
defendant.address: 11024 West Oklahoma Avenue, #507, West Allis, WI 53227

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Burgess Tremaine-Malik Smith Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Burgess Tremaine-Malik Smith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel requested a DPA hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.  rmm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.   rmm

Defendant Burgess Tremaine-Malik Smith Jr in court.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Burgess Tremaine-Malik Smith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held via zoom. Parties are continuing DPA negotiations. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 07/29/22 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 09/01/22.

Defendant Burgess Tremaine-Malik Smith in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Andrew Golden as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Golden accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 9/1/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Burgess Tremaine-Malik Smith in court.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-5-2022 @2p
